category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as Digital transition).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to Europes biodiversitys path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Project Website with a For Patients Section
result.description: Task 7.6 Dissemination and Communication. Lead Partner: NUIG. Partners Involved: All. Month 1-48.This task includes internal and external communication and dissemination as well as stakeholder engagement. Internal communication includes setting up a secure intranet to exchange information and to establish regular consortium discussions with all WP leaders. External communication includes setting up a publicly accessible webpage, active involvement, and information-sharing with stakeholders, regular updates of project results on a European level, and scientific publications in open access high-impact journals and during scientific conferences.

result.title: Publications
result.description: Compilation of publications:Two to three publications in international journals and the participation on three international conferences are foreseen per researcher working on the project. The journal and conferences will be related to the different areas targeted by the project: i) numerical methods; ii) additive manufacturing sciences; iii) advanced materials; iv) structural engineering; iv) UQ methods; v) biomechanics, etc. Co-supervised PhD theses will also be made public.

result.title: Surrogate model of the p.o.i. without the process parameters
result.description: Surrogate model of the macroscale property or interest (p.o.i.) trained using the stochastic FEM (D5.2) with the trained surrogate model of the meso-scale responses (D5.1) as random field input. The surrogate model is a subset of D6.1 which does not include the effect of the process parameters on the p.o.i. in order to go public.

result.title: FREL Implementation Report
result.description: Will report on the activities of MaaSive including the implementation results the integration and testing activities for all components developed within MaaSive for the FREL NoteIn the specific case of the after sales orchestrator a lower TRL is expected not higher than TRL 4 at the end of the project as previous existing versions were not mature enough to be updated in the course of the project The affected use cases are identified as follows UCTD4307 UCTD4315 UCTD4316 UCTD4320 UCTD4323 UCTD4401 UCTD4402
